content: Every expert was once a beginner. Every pro was once an amateur. Every icon was once an unknown.
author: Robin Sharma

content: The only way to learn programming is by writing programs.
author: Dennis Ritchie

content: Break down complex problems into smaller, manageable pieces. Solve one piece at a time.
Practice coding every day, even if it's just for 30 minutes. Consistency beats intensity.
ðŸŽ‰ Congratulations! You've solved your first problem. The journey of a thousand algorithms begins with a single solution!
Stuck on a problem? That's not failure, that's learning in action! Every 'bug' is a step closer to mastery.
Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad.
author: Cory House

content: Read other people's code to learn different approaches and coding styles. GitHub is your library!
ðŸš€ You're not just learning to code, you're learning to think like a problem solver!
Test your code with edge cases: empty inputs, single elements, maximum constraints.
